content:
Imam problem.

Ko sem inštaliral windowse, sem moral v biosu SATO "dizejblat", ker mi WIN XP ni prepoznal diska.

Sedaj sem našel sledečo zadevo:
http://h20000.www2.hp.com/bizs...Item=ob-39535-1

Če grem sedaj v bios in nastavim na SATA, mi windowsi ne zaštartajo. Kako bi lahko zadevo rešil, brez da še enkrat inštaliram Windowse?

TNX
author: YuGec

content: A si enejblal nazaj sata v biosu?
author: ynos

content:
Citat:
Uporabnik ynos pravi:
 A si enejblal nazaj sata v biosu?
		
		Klikni za razširitev
	

Sem probal ja, ampak se winsi ne štartajo.

Pa če pustim tako? Disk dela počasneje?
author: YuGec

content:
Ok, mogoče ne bi škodilo, če bi napisal, kaj imaš za eno računalo to...
Predvidevam, da si potem inštaliral na navaden (ata) disk. Ok, zdej če ti se ti ne boota če vklopiš sata, probaj sledeče: v biosu vklopi sata, potem se pa poigraj s first boot device, probaj nastavit na C: na katerem je trenutni OS, oziroma probaj še kaj drugega, kar ni sata.
author: Odisej

content:
Problem je bil sledeč:

Nabavil sem laptop HP s FreeDosom, nato sem dal inštalacijske windowse v računalo in mi je pri inštalaciji zmeraj prekinilo in napisalo, da kao ne najde diska. Šel sem v bios in SATA dizejblal in mi je inštalacija winsow takoj šla skozi. Če grem sedaj SATo vklopit, mi winsew ne naloži. Na linku, ki sem ga prilepil pa je rešitev kako omogočiš sato pri inštalacijo windowsow. Zanima me ali lahko to omogočim naknadno, torej sedaj, ko so winsi že inštalirani.
author: YuGec

content:
Ok...nič več jasno 
	

	
	
		
		

		
			
		
		
	


	
		
	


 po kakem standardu ti pa potem dela? Mislim, če disablaš sata kontroler, mi ni jasno, kot kaj ti je potem zaznal disk...če je bil pa disablan? 
Ja, sicer naj bi bil sata hitrejši od navadnega ata...

lp
Peter
author: Odisej

content:
Kreiraj oni flopi.

Poženi setup .exe na njem.

(če ni setup.exe, pa najdi *.inf fajl, desni klik in "Install")

nato reboot, spremeni opcijo vBIOS-u, milo, startaj Windows.



 eh, popravek: namesto "milo" sem mislil "moli"

Prodajalec mi je rekel, da naj bat ven jemljem in se mi je zdelo čudno, da nima sistema, da ko je baterija polna, da se nato elektrika "izogne" bateriji?! Prodajalec je dejal, da nekateri imajo tak sistem, drugi ne.

author: Odisej

content:
tole z disablanjem SATA (SATA native - disable) je fora pri novih SATA diskih in instalaciji WIN XP.....
brez tega se XP ne da naložiti, XP ne zazna diska....

		Klikni za razširitev
	
Ne moreš. Paket je tak "pameten" , da gre le na flopi.

Ali narediš to pri sosedu, ki ima disketnik (in disketo), ali pa emuliraš disketnik. Recimo z VMWare.
Ali pogledaš, če ima prizvajalec drivere tudi v kakem drugem paketu.
Ali počakaš, da kaka dobra duša, to naredi namesto tebe in ti lifra gotove drivere.
author: stein

content:
copy-paste iz drugega forume....


Joj kolkrat se ta problem pojavi po forumih. V glavnem skoz inštaliram ljudem te prenosnike in ena od opcij katera preverjeno deluje je tale. Ne bom prevajal bom kar ANG pomoč nalimal.

Steps to modify a Windows XP image to support SATA Native Mode 

1) Enter F10 Setup, and go to System Configuration/Device Configurations/SATA Native Mode to Disable. 
2) Install Windows XP Service Pack 2 in whatever manner is typical for your organization. 
3) Download the Intel SATA AHCI Controller Driver, SoftPaq SP32478.exe, from www.hp.com. 
4) Extract all the files from the SoftPaq. A USB floppy is necessary for this step. Run sp32478; this will create a floppy disk. The files will be located on this floppy. 
5) These files should be located on the floppy disk. 
a. iaahci.cat 
b. iaahci.inf 
c. iastor.cat 
d. iastor.inf 
e. iastor.sys 
f. license.txt 
g. readme.txt 
h. txtsetup.oem 
6) Download and run the Intel Chipset Installation Utility for ICH7, SoftPaq SP32781, from www.hp.com. 
7) In Device Manager, right-click the IDE ATA/ATAPI controllers/Intel 82801 GBM/GHM (ICH7-M Family) Serial ATA Storage Controller and select "Update Driver". 
8) Follow these steps to complete the Hardware Update Wizard: 
a. At the first dialog, select "No, not this time" when prompted to connect to Windows Update. 
b. At the next dialog, select "Install from a list or specific location (Advanced)". 
c. At the next dialog, select "Don't search. I will choose the driver to install". 
d. When prompted to select the device driver you want to install for this hardware, do not choose anything but click the "Have Disk..."-button.
e. Type "A:\" and click OK. 
f. When prompted to select the device driver you want to install for this hardware, select the Intel 82801GBM SATA AHCI Controller 
g. A warning that Windows cannot verify that the device is compatible with your hardware will appear. When asked if you want to continue installing the driver, select Yes. 
h. The installation will complete. 
9) Shut down Windows and restart the computer. Enter F10 setup when prompted during the boot. 
10) Go to System Configuration/Device Configurations/SATA Native Mode and change it to Enable, then save settings and exit F10 Setup. 
11) After Windows restarts, the additional SATA components will be updated. A System Settings Change will appear. When asked "Do you want to restart your computer now?" click Yes. 
12) When Windows restarts, the SATA AHCI drivers will be completely installed.
